disks:
74IAbY5 - This is the little Seagate 100GB SATA laptop drive that I bought to attempt to install a bootable Gentoo 2007.0 (when it becomes available) for Taki (my Sony Vaio VGN-SZ240P) as the primary XFS partitions and leave a 16GB fourth partition around as probably FAT32 for general mobile file-sharing. The drive will probably primarily reside in my black Vantec NexStar3 eSATA external enclosure (NST-260SU-BK NewEgg#:17-392-009) for now but my eventual plan is to get things working so smoothly that maybe the internal WindowsXP drive in Taki could become the external enclosed one and having this drive become Taki's primary internal bootable disk. Maybe Ubuntu's Feisty Fawn will prove a better choice than Gentoo for this goal.
Seagate SATA 1.5Gbps? 100GB Momentus 7200.1 ST910021AS SG-0YG010-12536-66R-E2SZ A00 Singapore 7200 8.02 +5V 0.56A 3MH0E2SZ 9S3014-030 06524 AMK
Do not cover breather hole! Canada Class B digital apparatus ICES-003 It seems there are four jumper pins but no diagram as to any potential purpose. Maybe this information is to be found online or in accompanying printed materials, if any non-default behaviors are even available.

# This was original ST320's fdisk partition table w/ ~256MB? /boot, 2GB swap, 256GB /, ~64GB empty space for 4th partition. # It was exactly duplicated to the second ST320 7200.10 I backed up to which is now the primary drive after another failed attempt to unmerge coldplug on orig.
